page.title: 08LIFE STYLES 2
page.content: The shepherd knows of only 4 locally born people (other than youngsters) in the area today. The village has changed beyond recognition. There used to be a{BLACKSMITH,}wheelwright, butcher, grocer and a baker. Today most of the inhabitants work far away. There are far fewer farms with only a tiny workforce. The landscape has not changed much though, there never were many hedgerows. You notice that some of the{WILDLIFE,}has gone. No Barn Owls, Frogs or Efts (Newts) and there has not been an otter seen since 1958 The old times were hard, getting up at 4am to feed the horses and working in all weathers. After a lifetime they would throw you out of your cottage when you could not do a days work anymore. You had to take yourself off to the{WORKHOUSE.
